description._content: Image taken from: Title: "[The Story of Lady Courten [extracted from Thomas Gibbons's “Memoirs of Eminently Pious Women”], of Mr. John Mortimer, and Matthias Dolanscius, who was saved from starving by a little bird which brought a piece of gold to the window of his prison. [Containing also “Meditation by Bishop Hall, on a robin red-breast singing at his chamber window.”]]" Author: COURTEN, Catharine - Lady Shelfmark: "British Library HMNTS 1077.g.37.(21.)" Page: 9 Place of Publishing: London Date of Publishing: 1820 Publisher: J. Evans & Sons Edition: [Another edition.] Issuance: monographic Identifier: 000801487 Note: The colours, contrast and appearance of these illustrations are unlikely to be true to life. They are derived from scanned images that have been enhanced for machine interpretation and have been altered from their originals.
